Module opentdk.api
Package org.opentdk.api.datastorage

Class BaseContainer

java.lang.Object
org.opentdk.api.datastorage.BaseContainer
Direct Known Subclasses:
DataContainer
public abstract class BaseContainer
extends Object
Super Class for DataContainer including common properties and their getter and setter methods. In addition the BaseContainer class includes all protected methods that will be used by 'unbound' methods of classes within the datastorage package.
Author:
LK Test Solutions GmbH

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  BaseContainer.EContainerFormat
    Enumeration that defines all source types, supported by the org.opentdk.api.datastorage package with its header format.
    static class  BaseContainer.EHeader
    Enumeration that defines all header formats supported by the org.opentdk.api.datastorage package.

    Property that stores the container format for the instance of the DataContainer as an enum of type BaseContainer.EContainerFormat.

    Full path and name of the file for DataContainers with file based sources like CSVDataContainer, PropertiesDataContainer or XMLDataContainer.

    The headerNames property is used to assign header names to each index of the String Arrays, stored as elements of the ArrayList values.

    This property defines the record index of the source, where the header names are read from.
    protected Set<String> implicitHeaders
    This property is used for the adaption of different source formats, to make the data accessible in a similar way, as they were organized in tabular format.
    e.g.
    protected InputStream inputStream
    This property is used to assign the data as an InputStream to the DataContainer instance in case that no source file exists.
    protected HashMap<String,​String> metaData
    The HashMap metaData is used to define fields and values that will be appended to each record added to the DataContainer by the DataContainer.readData(), DataContainer.addRow() and the DataContainer.appendData(String) methods.
    e.g. add the name of the source file to each record, when putting the content of multiple files into one instance of the DataContainer.
    protected ResultSet resultSet
    Keeps the SQL result set of RSDataContainer
    protected ArrayList<String[]> values
    ArrayList with an Array of Strings where content of tabular sources is stored at runtime of an application.

    This method is similar to the putMetaData(java.lang.String, java.lang.String) method with the difference, that existing metadata with the same headerName will be overwritten.

    Assigns an object of type ResultSet with SQL results to the property resultSet.

  • Field Details

    • columnDelimiter

      protected String columnDelimiter
      The character(s) that define the delimiter of columns within tabular files. This delimiter is used by the DataContainer.readData() methods to split the rows of the source file into a String Array and by the DataContainer.exportContainer(String) methods to write the elements of the values ArrayList into the target file.

    • containerFormat

      protected BaseContainer.EContainerFormat containerFormat
      Property that stores the container format for the instance of the DataContainer as an enum of type BaseContainer.EContainerFormat.

    • fileName

      protected String fileName
      Full path and name of the file for DataContainers with file based sources like CSVDataContainer, PropertiesDataContainer or XMLDataContainer. This file will be used as default for all read and write methods that are called without an explicit file attribute.

    • headerNames

      protected final HashMap<String,​Integer> headerNames
      The headerNames property is used to assign header names to each index of the String Arrays, stored as elements of the ArrayList values. This HashMap allows to locate values within the String Arrays by name instead of index.
      e.g. if the first row of a CSV-file includes header names and all other rows include values, then the names of the first row will be stored in the headerNames HashMap with their original index.

    • headerNamesIndex

      protected int headerNamesIndex
      This property defines the record index of the source, where the header names are read from. All values of this record will be put into the HashMap headerNames.
      - If the headerType of the DataContainer is BaseContainer.EHeader.COLUMN, then headerNamesIndex defines the row index of the source that includes the header names.
      - If the headerType of the DataContainer is BaseContainer.EHeader.ROW, then headerNamesIndex defines the column index of the source that includes the header names.

    • implicitHeaders

      protected Set<String> implicitHeaders
      This property is used for the adaption of different source formats, to make the data accessible in a similar way, as they were organized in tabular format.
      e.g. Source data of tree format will be transposed into a tree table with the parent path stored within an additional column for each node. This allows access to the node with the same methods as implemented for tabular formated data.

    • inputStream

      protected InputStream inputStream
      This property is used to assign the data as an InputStream to the DataContainer instance in case that no source file exists. This is valid for data formats like XML, JSON or JAML.

    • metaData

      protected final HashMap<String,​String> metaData
      The HashMap metaData is used to define fields and values that will be appended to each record added to the DataContainer by the DataContainer.readData(), DataContainer.addRow() and the DataContainer.appendData(String) methods.
      e.g. add the name of the source file to each record, when putting the content of multiple files into one instance of the DataContainer. 
       Code sample:
 DataContainer dc = new DataContainer(";", EHeader.COLUMN);
 dc.putMetaData("Filename", "Attendees_FirstAid_Course_Q4-2020.csv"));
 dc.readData("./data/Attendees_FirstAid_Course_Q4-2020.csv");
 dc.putMetaData("Filename", "Attendees_FirstAid_Course_Q1-2021.csv"));
 dc.readData("./data/Attendees_FirstAid_Course_Q1-2021.csv");

    • resultSet

      protected ResultSet resultSet
      Keeps the SQL result set of RSDataContainer

    • values

      protected ArrayList<String[]> values
      ArrayList with an Array of Strings where content of tabular sources is stored at runtime of an application.
      - If the associated source includes row-based records and column-based fields like SQL result sets, CSV-files etc., then each element of the ArrayList represents a row of the source and the header names are column headers of the source.
      - If the associated source includes column-based records and row-based fields like Properties-files, then the data will be transposed while writing into the ArrayList. In this case each element of the ArrayList represents a column of the source and the header names are row headers of the source.
      - If the associated source is not in tabular format, then the data will not be stored within the ArrayList. In this case the adapted DataContainer class needs to implement the logic how to store the data at runtime e.g. Document for HTML- and XML-files.

  • Constructor Details

    • BaseContainer

      public BaseContainer()

  • Method Details

    • addMetaHeaders

      protected String[] addMetaHeaders​(String[] inArray)
      Adds the header names from HashMap metaData to an array of strings. Header names are read from the key names of the entrySets of HashMap metaData.
      Parameters:
      inArray - Array of strings with header names from HashMap headerNames
      Returns:
      concatenated array of strings with all key names of HashMap metaData and values of the array "inArray"

    • addMetaValues

      protected String[] addMetaValues​(String[] inArray)
      Adds the values from HashMap metaData to an array of strings. Values are read from the values of the entrySets of HashMap metaData.
      Parameters:
      inArray - Array of strings with values from ArrayList values
      Returns:
      concatenated array of strings with all values of HashMap metaData and the array "inArray"

    • checkHeader

      public int checkHeader​(String[] compareHeaders)
      Compares an array of type String with defined header names with the header names and indexes of the current DataContainer.
      Parameters:
      compareHeaders - Array of type String with header names and indexes which will be compared against the headers of the current object instance.
      Returns:
       -1 = mismatching headers
 0 = header names and indexes are identical
 1 = header names match, but with different index order

    • checkHeader

      public int checkHeader​(HashMap<String,​Integer> compareHeaders)
      Compares the assigned HashMap with header names and indexes with the headers of the current DataContainer instance.
      Parameters:
      compareHeaders - HashMap with header names and indexes which will be compared against the headers of the current object instance.
      Returns:
       -1 = mismatching headers
 0 = header names and indexes are identical
 1 = header names match, but with different index order

    • checkHeader

      public int checkHeader​(String[] referenceHeaders, String[] compareHeaders)
      Compares the names and order of two Arrays of type String.
      Parameters:
      referenceHeaders - Array of type String with header names and indexes which include reference values for comparison.
      compareHeaders - Array of type String with header names and indexes which include comparison values.
      Returns:
       -1 = mismatching headers
 0 = header names and indexes are identical
 1 = header names match, but with different index order

    • checkHeader

      public int checkHeader​(HashMap<String,​Integer> referenceHeaders, String[] compareHeaders)
      Compares the header names and order of a HashMap with header names and order of an Arrays of type String.
      Parameters:
      referenceHeaders - Array of type String with header names and indexes which include reference values for comparison.
      compareHeaders - Array of type String with header names and indexes which include comparison values.
      Returns:
       -1 = mismatching headers
 0 = header names and indexes are identical
 1 = header names match, but with different index order

    • checkValuesFilter

      protected boolean checkValuesFilter​(String[] values, Filter fltr) throws Exception
      Checks, if the filter rules match to the values of the given data set.
      Parameters:
      values - String Array with all values of a defined dataset (row).
      fltr - Object of type Filter, which includes one or more filter rules
      Returns:
      true = values match to the filter; false = values don't match to the
      Throws:
      Exception - If any error occurs it should be logged with the MLogger to get details about it.

    • cleanValues

      protected String[] cleanValues​(String[] inArray)
      This method is used to prepare an Array of strings before inserting the values into the ArrayList values.

      e.g. remove enclosing quotes for each value in the array
      inArray = "val1", "val2", "val3", "val4"
      return = val1, val2, val3, val4
      Parameters:
      inArray - an Array of strings whose values are cleaned up
      Returns:
      an Array of strings with cleaned values

    • extendDataSet

      protected String[] extendDataSet​(String[] inArray, String target)
      This method is used to add the values stored in HashMap metaData to an array of strings and returns the extended array.
      Parameters:
      inArray - array of strings with all values from ArrayList values or header names from HashMap headerNames
      target - valid values are "HEADER" and "VALUE" - this defines where to get the value value from HashMap metaData (HEADER=getKey(); VALUE=getValue();)
      Returns:
      the extended array.

    • getColumnDelimiter

      public String getColumnDelimiter()
      Get the delimiter character(s) that separates the columns in the source file. The delimiter will be used for splitting the data rows and transfer them into a String Array.
      Returns:
      The character(s) used for column separation in the source file.

    • getContainerFormat

      public BaseContainer.EContainerFormat getContainerFormat()
      Gets the value of the property containerFormat which keeps information about the format of the source that is associated to the DataContainer.
      Returns:
      ENUM element of type BaseContainer.EContainerFormat

    • getFileName

      public String getFileName()
      Gets the full path and name of the source file from which the data will be loaded into the DataContainer.
      Returns:
      full path and name of the source file

    • getHeaderIndex

      public int getHeaderIndex​(String headerName)
      Gets the index value of a defined headerName.
      Parameters:
      headerName - Name of the header for which to retrieve the index.
      Returns:
      Index value of type integer.

    • getHeaderName

      public String getHeaderName​(int headerIndex)
      Parameters:
      headerIndex - The key of the header in the headers map.
      Returns:
      The header name at the committed position as string value.

    • getHeaderNamesIndexed

      public String[] getHeaderNamesIndexed()
      Returns the header names from the headerNames HashMap as string array, ordered by their index.
      Returns:
      String array with header names

    • getHeaderOccurances

      public int getHeaderOccurances​(String toMatch)
      Gets the number of headers that match a given regular expression.
      Parameters:
      toMatch - regular expression to search for in header names
      Returns:
      number of header-names that match the regex

    • getHeaderRowIndex

      public int getHeaderRowIndex()
      Gets the index of the header row within the source file.
      Returns:
      row index

    • getHeaders

      public HashMap<String,​Integer> getHeaders()
      Gets the HashMap headerNames that includes the names and indexes of column headers within the instance of the DataContainer.
      Returns:
      headerNames HashMap

    • getHeadersIndexed

      public HashMap<Integer,​String> getHeadersIndexed()
      Gets the HashMap columnHeaders with reversed key/value assignment. Whereas the original columnHeaders # HashMap uses the header names as key and their index as value, this method returns a HashMap with the index as key and the header name as value.
      Returns:
      HashMap with indexes and names of the columnHeaders HashMap

    • getHeadersIndexes

      public int[] getHeadersIndexes​(String headerName)
      This method returns an array of type integer with the indexes of defined header names. This can either be a single header, a semicolon separated string with multiple headers, or an empty string that returns the indexes of all headers.
      Parameters:
      headerName - 
                         - single headername (e.g.
                   getColumnHeadersIndexes("Firstname");) - semicolon
                   separated value with multiple headernames (e.g.
                   getColumnHeadersIndexes("Firstname;Surname;Email;Phone");)
                   - empty string for all available headernames
                   (getColumnHeadersIndexes("");)
      Returns:
      Array of type integer with header indexes in the order as defined by the headerName parameter

    • getImplFilterRules

      protected List<FilterRule> getImplFilterRules​(Filter fltr)
      Returns the filter rules which belong to an implicit header column. This allows to use same column and row based getter and setter methods for tree formatted sources like XML, as they are used for tabular formatted sources. e.g. the getImplFilterRules(Filter) method is used within XMLDataContainer.getColumn(java.lang.String, org.opentdk.api.datastorage.Filter) to limit the data records for the search to specified xPath(s).
      Parameters:
      fltr - Filter object with the complete filter rules for a data search
      Returns:
      List object with all FilterRules that belong to implicit columns

    • getImplicitHeaders

      public Set<String> getImplicitHeaders()
      Sets the name of columns that will be populated with processed data by implemented logic of the individual DataContainer. e.g. The implicitHeaders will be used by the XMLDataContainer to add the column XPath, where the complete path of each tag will be inserted. This allows to transpose data from tree format into tabular format.
      Returns:
      object of type java.util.set with column names

    • getInputStream

      public InputStream getInputStream()

    • getMetaData

      public HashMap<String,​String> getMetaData()
      Gets the HashMap with MetaData
      Returns:
      the metaData HashMap of this object instance

    • getResultSet

      public ResultSet getResultSet()
      Returns the resultSet property with SQL results of type ResultSet. This property is used to store the data of RSDataContainer.
      Returns:
      resultSet

    • putMetaData

      public void putMetaData​(String headerName, String value)
      Inserts additional headers and values into the DataContanier that will added to the DataSets, transmitted from the sources. e.g. If you create an instance of CSVDataContainer with a csv.file as source, you can put the file content into the CSVDataContainer and add the filename to each DataSet.
      The following sample reads contact data from CSV file and adds the column Company with the company name for each data set while putting the data into the CSVDataContainer. 
       DataContainer dc = new DataContainer(";", EHeader.COLUMN); // creates a CSVDataContainer
 dc.putMetaData("Company", "happy inc.");
 dc.readData("c:\\data\\happy-inc.csv");

      The readData method of the appropriate DataContainer instance will automatically extend all DataSets with all headers and values, added to the metaData HashMap.

      Parameters:
      headerName - Header name of DataSet within the DataContainer
      value - Value as String that will be added to each DataSet into the column of headerName

    • setColumnDelimiter

      public void setColumnDelimiter​(String cDel)
      Sets the columnDelimiter property which is used for splitting the data rows of the source file into a String Array.
      Parameters:
      cDel - The character(s) used for column separation in the source file.

    • setContainerFormat

      public void setContainerFormat​(BaseContainer.EContainerFormat cFormat)
      Sets the format information of the source used for this instance of DataContainer.
      Parameters:
      cFormat - ENUM value of type EContainerFormat

    • setFileName

      public void setFileName​(String file)
      Sets the property fileName with the full path and name of the source file.
      Parameters:
      file - Full path and name of the source file as String

    • setHeaderRowIndex

      public void setHeaderRowIndex​(int headerIndex)
      Sets the index of the header row within the source file.
      Parameters:
      headerIndex - Zero based index where the names of header are placed.

    • setHeaders

      public void setHeaders​(List<String> in_headers)
      Adds header names into the HashMap headerNames. It's proofed if the name already exists in the HashMap. In case of duplicated names, an index suffix will be added to the name (i.e GF#,GF#_2 ...). Furthermore, the name of the header is added with an index (i) as "helper" for the assignment of headers to the values.
      Parameters:
      in_headers - List with the name of the headers to be added

    • setHeaders

      public void setHeaders​(String[] in_headers)
      Adds header names into the HashMap headerNames. It's proofed if the name already exists in the HashMap. In case of duplicated names, an index suffix will be added to the name (i.e GF#,GF#_2 ...). Furthermore, the name of the header is added with an index (i) as "helper" for the assignment of headers to the values.
      Parameters:
      in_headers - Array with the name of the headers to be added

    • setInputStream

      public void setInputStream​(InputStream inStream)
      Sets content of type InputStream to the inputStream property that is used by DataContainers that have document type data connected like XMLDataContainer using Document for XML and HTML formats. The inputStream property can be used in case that the data source is not a file.
      Parameters:
      inStream - Data of type InputStream

    • setMetaData

      public void setMetaData​(String headerName, String value)
      This method is similar to the putMetaData(java.lang.String, java.lang.String) method with the difference, that existing metadata with the same headerName will be overwritten. This method should be used preferably to avoid duplicated column headers.
      Parameters:
      headerName - Header name of DataSet within the DataContainer
      value - Value as String that will be added to each DataSet into the column of headerName

    • setResultSet

      public void setResultSet​(ResultSet rs)
      Assigns an object of type ResultSet with SQL results to the property resultSet. This property is used by the RSDataContainer
      Parameters:
      rs - Object of type ResultSet
